docs.title: Hard copy
docs.text:
Need to download or print our hookup guide?

  • Print (Single-Page View)
    • To save as a *.pdf file, select the Printer or Destination labeled Save as PDF. (Instructions will vary based on the browser)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This is a fairly straightforward board. The primary use for this is to provide a way to swap pins from right to left and vice versa.

docs.title: Qwiic Connector
docs.text: There is a Qwiic connector available that provides power and I2C connectivity simultaneously to a wide array of our Qwiic Sensors.

docs.title: Reset Button
docs.text: A reset button is useful in many projects. We've added one to the edge of the board.

docs.title: USB Silkscreen
docs.text: The USB Silkscreen on the back of the board is provided for orientation purposes.

docs.title: I2C Jumper
docs.text:
If you choose to use one or more Qwiic breakouts in your project, it is important to note that this board comes equipped with pull-up resistors on the clock and data pins. If you are daisy-chaining multiple Qwiic devices, you will want to cut this jumper; if multiple sensors are connected to the bus with the pull-up resistors enabled, the parallel equivalent resistance will create too strong of a pull-up for the bus to operate correctly. As a general rule of thumb, disable all but one pair of pull-up resistors if multiple devices are connected to the bus. To disable the pull up resistors, use an X-acto knife to cut the joints between theWS jumper pads highlighted below.

I2C Jumper

docs.title: 3D Model
docs.text:
A 3D model of the board and components was exported to a STEP file using KiCad.

Click Here for the STEP File

docs.title: Board Dimensions
docs.text:
The board measures 1" x 2".

Board Dimensions

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text:
• SparkFun Pico Add-On Flipper for XRP SKU: COM-28236

  • Whether you are working with the PICO or the XRP, the SparkFun Pico Add-On Flipper Board provides flexibility when space is at a premium. Whereas most Pico add-on boards are designed to go on the bottom of a Pico with male headers, the XRP has female headers on top. This board enables users to flip those add-on boards to be on top of the XRP. Should you wish to use the SparkFun Pico Add On Flipper Board in non-XRP applications, we've also included a Qwiic connector and reset button.

    Purchase from SparkFun

docs.title: General Troubleshooting Help
docs.text:
Note

Not working as expected and need help?

If you need technical assistance and more information on a product that is not working as you expected, we recommend heading on over to the SparkFun Technical Assistance page for some initial troubleshooting.

SparkFun Technical Assistance Page

If you don't find what you need there, the SparkFun Forums are a great place to find and ask for help. If this is your first visit, you'll need to create a forum account to search product forums and post questions.

Log Into SparkFun Forums

docs.title: Contribute: Help Fix our Mistake!
docs.text: Spot something wrong? Feel free to contribute our open-source design and documentation.

docs.title: Improve our Documentation
docs.text:
All of this documentation can be modified by you! Please help us make it better.

  • These pages are contained in the docs folder of the SparkFun Ideal Diode Breakout repository.

docs.title: Submit a Correction
docs.text:
1. Fork this repo
  2. Add your corrections or improvements to the markdown file
  3. File a pull request with your changes, and enjoy making the words worlds world a better place.
    • Once received, the documentation specialist will automatically be notified.
    • We will review your suggested improvements to make sure they are correct and fit within our documentation standards.

docs.title: Improve our Hardware Design
docs.text:
All of our designs are open-source! Please help us make it better.

  • Our board design files are contained in the Hardware folder of the SparkFun Ideal Diode Breakout repository.

docs.title: Submit a Design Improvement
docs.text:
1. Fork this repo
  2. Add your design improvements
  3. File a pull request with your changes, and enjoy making the words worlds world a better place.
    • Once received, the engineer in charge of the original design will automatically be notified.
    • We will review your suggested improvements, if they are within our board design standards and meet our product design requirements, we will flag these changes for our next board revision. (Please note, that even if your suggestion is accepted, these changes may not be immediate. We may have to cycle through our current product inventory first.)

docs.title: Contributors
docs.text: Let's provided some recognition to the contributors for this project!

docs.title: Did we make a mistake?
docs.text:
Spot something wrong? Please let us know.

Attention

This is not where customers should seek assistance on a product. If you require technical assistance or have questions about a product that is not working as expected, please head over to the SparkFun Technical Assistance page for some initial troubleshooting. SparkFun Technical Assistance Page

If you can't find what you need there, you'll need a Forum Account to search product forums and post questions.

docs.title: Discrepancies in the Documentation
docs.text:
All of this documentation can be modified by you! Please help us make it better.

  • The documentation files for these pages are contained in the docs folder of the SparkFun Ideal Diode Breakout repository.

docs.title: Spot something wrong?
docs.text: If a section of the documentation is incorrect, please open an issue and let us know.

docs.title: Do you have a suggested correction?
docs.text:
1. With a GitHub account, fork this repo
  2. Add your correction(s) or improvement(s) to the markdown file(s)
  3. File a pull request with your changes, and enjoy making the words worlds world a better place.
    • Once received, the documentation specialist will automatically be notified.
    • We will review your suggested improvement(s) to make sure they are correct and fit within our documentation standards.

docs.title: Problems in the Hardware Design
docs.text:
All of our designs are open-source! Please help us make it better.

  • Our board design files are contained in the Hardware folder of the SparkFun Ideal Diode Breakout repository.

docs.title: Does something not make sense?
docs.text: If part of the design is confusing, please open an issue and let us know.

docs.title: Did we forget to include an important function of the board?
docs.text:
• Please keep in mind that we may intentionally exclude certain functions of the board to meet our product design requirements. (For example, our Qwiic Micro boards are intended to fit on a small board layout and only use I2C communication; therefore, we may not have the SPI and interrupt pins available for users.)
  • If part of the board's functionality is missing, please open an issue and file a feature request.

docs.title: Do you wish to contribute directly to improving the board design?
docs.text:
1. With a GitHub account, Fork this repo
  2. Add your design improvement(s)
  3. File a pull request with your changes, and enjoy making the words worlds world a better place.
    • Once received, the engineer in charge of the original design will automatically be notified.
    • We will review your suggested improvement(s), if they are within our board design standards and meet our product design requirements, we will flag these changes for our next board revision. (Please note, that even if your suggestion is accepted, these changes may not be immediate. We may have to cycle through our current product inventory first.)
